content:
Yes, the Toronto Raptors have signed some new players during the offseason. One of the most notable signings is Aron Baynes, a center who was previously with the Phoenix Suns. Baynes is known for his physicality, rebounding, and three-point shooting ability. He will likely bring some much-needed size to the Raptors' frontcourt.

Another important addition to the team is DeAndre' Bembry, a versatile shooting guard who was previously with the Atlanta Hawks. Bembry is known for his solid defense and ball-handling skills, but he will also contribute to the team's offense with his ability to attack the basket and hit three-point shots.

Finally, the Raptors also signed Malachi Flynn, a rookie point guard who they selected with the 29th pick in the 2020 NBA Draft. Flynn is known for his excellent ball-handling skills, high basketball IQ, and three-point shooting ability. He will likely be a valuable addition to the Raptors' backcourt rotation.

Overall, these signings indicate that the Raptors are looking to bolster their defensive presence and add more shooting to their offense.
